meanings.definition: To abandon or leave someone or something behind.
meanings.sent1: She was forsaking her old home for a new one.
meanings.sent2: He felt guilty for forsaking his loyal dog at the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to be forsaking its favorite toy, only to pounce on it later.
meanings.sent4: The soldier felt like forsaking his duty, but he knew he had to stay strong.
meanings.sent5: The image of forsaking her childhood teddy bear haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: To renounce or give up a belief or principle.
meanings.sent1: He was forsaking his unhealthy eating habits for a better lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: She was forsaking her fear of heights to conquer the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about forsaking his love for pizza, but everyone knew it was a lie.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like forsaking realism for abstract art to express his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The student was forsaking procrastination to focus on his studies.

meanings.definition: Abandonment or renunciation of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The forsaking of the old factory led to its decay.
meanings.sent2: The forsaking of his dreams left him feeling lost.
meanings.sent3: The forsaking of the treasure map turned out to be a big mistake.
meanings.sent4: The forsaking of her friendship with Sarah was a decision she regretted.
meanings.sent5: The forsaking of his favorite book was a sacrifice he had to make for his education.
